meanings.definition: An allergic condition caused by pollen.
meanings.sent1: My sister suffers from pollinosis every spring when the flowers bloom.
meanings.sent2: During pollinosis season, many people experience sneezing and itchy eyes.
meanings.sent3: The bees seemed to be mocking me, knowing my pollinosis would act up if I got too close to the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The blanket of pollen in the air felt like a cloud of pollinosis descending upon the town.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's description of pollinosis made it sound like an invisible enemy attacking my immune system.

meanings.sent1: After playing in the park, my brother's red eyes and runny nose were clear signs of pollinosis.
meanings.sent2: During peak pollinosis season, pharmacies sell out of allergy medication quickly.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but chuckle at the idea of a superhero whose only weakness was pollinosis.
meanings.sent4: The intensity of her sneezing fits was like a storm of pollinosis wreaking havoc on her sinuses.
meanings.sent5: The image of a field of flowers turning into a battlefield against pollinosis stuck in my mind.
